item.title: There is a wide expanse of broken tarmac, 19th October
item.description:
This problem has been reported multiple times. There was even notification of the road to be repaired on the 15th Sept, the road was marked. I received an email to say it was repaired. Sadly, the road was not closed on the 15th, no repair took place the lines around the damage has now worn away. This problem is only getting worse. When will this work be completed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole still not draining, 19th October
item.description:
It's the 3rd time I report issues with drainage for the same spot. With just a few drops of rain, this start accumulated water and we had to use sandbags already. It's not acceptable. Recent ticket was closed and nothing has changed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vineyard Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All slips roads and roundabout covered in litter and rubbish, 19th October
item.description:
All slip roads and the roundabout are covered in litter and rubbish. This is the first impression for visitors to Cheltenham and Gloucester and sets a poor precedent. Perhaps some additional liaison with Highways England.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish and litter along entire corridor of Gloucester Road., 19th October
item.description:
There is rubbish, litter and fly tipping along the entire corridor of the Gloucester Road. Particularly in the central reservation and by the Armco barrier near the BMW garage. Why is there no litter bin in the lay-by on the Cheltenham approach? This road and the junction with the M5 is a key gateway to both Gloucester and Cheltenham and the first impression for many visit both especially when key events are on and set ms a poor impression. Why is this corridor not tidied or cleaned on a consistent and regular basis?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Orange safety barriers in front of highways signage, 19th October
item.description:
Orange barriers in front of highways signage next to the new park and ride as you turn left at the roundabout from Hatherley Lane onto Gloucester Road dual carriage way. Been there since the works were undertaken?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unrepaired crash barrier highways signs, 19th October
item.description:
Gloucester Rd on central reservation opposite the Harvester and Travelodge. The barrier has been damaged for months and the detritus and warning signs have been abandoned. The lack of efficient and timely repair is a public and highways safety concern, let alone how unsightly it looks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Circa 8ft fallen tree branch on driveway of 42 Boverton Drive, 19th October
item.description:
Fallen branch fell on to property at 42 Boverton Drive adjacent to car. Branch had potential to fall onto pavement/pedestrian and cause injury. Branch has been relocated to verge for collection/inspection. As the tree is unmaintained and continues to encroach on properties it is recommended that the tree is inspected and cut back to mitigate future falling branchs which could damage property or cause injury to people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Boverton Drive, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Light outside 5 Newdawn Place and opposite side are off and have been for several nights. Very dark outside, not helped by uneven road surfaces.

item.title: Need to review the repair at the top of the hill, 18th October
item.description:
Previous ref - Web Reference: 7884069 | Enquiry Number: 22082475 TWO large tarmac patch, this one, and one northbound at the top of the hill, both with leading lip edges that cause a violent jolt on the car/vehicle. This one still has a leading edge to it (FYI, the northbound one has a hump of new tarmac over it, which is NOT good enough and is making things worse - and I've raised a NEW separate report on it now). I had previously asked if these edges could be made lower or smoother. Can you PLEASE grind down the tarmac and make it level to the road surface ASAP. For both of these patches, Glos Highways will be liable for car suspension damage !!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
